text: Paradoxical priming effects of <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on cytokine production .
<extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a well-known immunosuppressive and / or anti-inflammatory cytokine .

However , we report in vitro experimental studies in which <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> primed leukocytes and led to an enhanced production of <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) upon further stimulation by lipopolysaccharide ( LPS ) .

text: Monocytes and peripheral blood mononuclear cells ( PBMC ) prepared from whole blood maintained for 20 h at 37 degrees C in the presence of recombinant human <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> had an enhanced capacity to produce <extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in response to LPS .

text: In addition to <extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , LPS - induced <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and spontaneous <extra_id_0> IL-1ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production were also enhanced .

text: When isolated PBMC were first cultured for 20 h in the presence of <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on Teflon to prevent adherence , washed to remove <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and then further cultured in plastic dishes for an additional 20 h in the presence of LPS or <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , an enhanced release of <extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was observed .

text: This was not the case when PBMC were pre-cultured in plastic multidishes in the presence of <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

TNF mRNA expression induced by LPS was decreased when the pre-treatment of PBMC with <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was performed on plastic , whereas this was not the case when cells were pre-cultured with <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on Teflon .
Furthermore , NFkappaB translocation following LPS activation was higher after <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> pre-treatment on Teflon than on plastic .

Interestingly , an enhanced frequency of <extra_id_0> CD16 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CD68 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( + ) cells among the <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( + ) cells was observed in the presence of <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , independently of the pre-culture conditions of the PBMC .

Altogether , these results indicate that the <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced up-regulation of cytokine production depends on the prevention of monocyte adherence by red cells in the whole blood assays or by cultures of PBMC on Teflon .
In contrast , the adherence parameter has no effect on the <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced modulation of some monocyte surface markers .
